channel.title: iptables to nftables transition - Upstream developments
channel.description:
Blog post by netilter dev on the upcoming transition from iptables to nftables. A suite of legacy compatible binaries will be available to allow interoperability of iptables rules with the nftables backend.
http://ral-arturo.org/2018/06/16/nfws2018.html

item.title: iptables to nftables transition - Upstream developments
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
This thread isnâ€™t about having compatible front-ends with nftables, but making sure iptables rulesets are still compatible going forward and researching programs that can transform these older rulesets into something that is 100% equivalent in nft

item.source: iptables to nftables transition - Upstream developments

item.title: iptables to nftables transition - Upstream developments
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
There are easier tools to deal with them like:

(They are not cross compatible)
gufw/ufw with iptables
firewalld with nftables

gufw can be used with nftables through iptables backward compatibility called iptables-nft (though for the future its recommended against to have any iptables stuff to begin with)

Read full topic
